case_vignette: A 65-year-old male presents to derm   atology clinic for evaluation of multiple spots on the face present since adolescence but increasing in number. His past med   ical hist   ory is remarkable for multiple pulmon ary cysts, spontan   eous pneumothorax and renal cell carcino ma. He reports a positive family history of multiple renal cysts and recurrent pneumothor   ax. Physical examination reveals multiple ligh t hypopigmented to skin colored dome shaped papules on the face and pedunculated hyperpigmented papules o   n th  e neck and axilla.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I am here for an evaluation of multiple spots on my face that have been present since adolescence and have been increasing in number.
Are these spots flat or raised, and have they changed in color or size since they first appeared?
The spots are raised and they are light or similar to my skin color on my face, and darker on my neck and underarms.
Do these spots cause any itching or pain?
No, the spots do not cause any itching or pain.
Have any of your family members experienced similar skin conditions?
Yes, I have a family history of multiple renal cysts and recurrent spontaneous collapsing of the lung, but it's not specified if they had similar skin conditions.
Have you experienced any issues or complications related to your kidneys or lungs?
Yes, I have a history of multiple lung cysts, spontaneous lung collapse, and kidney cancer.
Final Diagnosis: Birt-Hogg-Dubé syndrome
